ai-tha-ap372:0.3_0: the Elder Tāvatiṁsa went to a beautiful flower,
ai-tha-ap372:1.1_0: “One from the bank of the river,
ai-tha-ap372:3.1_0: Having received it from the Sambuddha, the Awakened One,
ai-tha-ap372:4.2_0: I paid homage to the supreme Buddha.
ai-tha-ap372:4.3_0: raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-tha-ap372:4.4_0: again to the mountain, or mountains;
ai-tha-ap372:5.2_0: As a bird was worshipped by the flowers,
ai-tha-ap372:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap372:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Saṅgārava.
ai-tha-ap372:8.1_0: the tenth Elder Nun Bhaddiya was Uppalavaṇṇā,
ai-tha-ap372:9.1_0: The seventh sub-chapter on scents is finished.
ai-tha-ap372:11.2_0: they crawled about with hoes here and there,
ai-tha-ap372:11.3_0: the one who goes from Kaṅkhārea,
